intro: Inti nigrolabia, commonly known as the black-lipped orchid, is a species native to the Andean region of South America. It is a terrestrial orchid with a distinctive appearance, featuring dark purple to black lips on its flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its flowers are usually small to medium in size, with intricate patterns that attract specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Inti nigrolabia is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
